column4: 32 vs 64 bit ubuntu: if my comp (c2d) supports 64-bit, any reason not to use it?
there might be a few issues, with say Java Firefox Flash plugin, but otherwise should be alright
64bit is better than 32bit
sure, and you can even run 32bit programs on it
ah then there's no good reason for me not to use it... wine works too i assume?
yes
how much RAM?
3GB
that's good
,but I think you might not really get any 64bit advantages unless you got 4GB RAM at least
im hoping to get faster compile speeds and possibly performance out of x86 emus via 64-bit
also there's  a Adobe Flash for 64bit Linux that is meant to be better than the others, that you can get from site
if you want more speed well
Ext4 is an option in the next Ubuntu  in April
and you would have to do the partitions again for that so  yeah
maybe just keep 32bit Intrepid Ibex for now?  you are on Intrepid?  and then  start over  with Jaunty and use Ext4
i have no linux install atm
gonna need one to work with in the meantime anyway
oh  so your on Windows?
yeah, but not new to linux or anything
been using it for years
well you could try a few distros out inside WIndows in virtualbox
not rly necessary :D
